issues.description: The solution header declares a different name for the fixed-point dot-product function than the rest of the code and the template. In solution_repository/example_program/src/math_fix.h the prototype is declared as fix_vector_dot(...), while the implementation and the rest of the code (inline wrapper and callers) use fix_vec_dot(...) / fix_vec_dot_asm(...). This name mismatch between the header and the implementation/call sites will cause compilation or linkage errors and will confuse students about the correct API to implement/use.
issues.suggested_fix: Restore a single consistent API name. Change the prototype in solution_repository/example_program/src/math_fix.h from fix_vector_dot(...) to fix_vec_dot(...) (matching the implementation and callers), or alternatively rename the implementation and all call sites to fix_vector_dot. Prefer the former (fix_vec_dot) to match the template, tests, and existing implementation.

issues.description: The solution repository's math_fix.h declares a function named fix_vector_dot(...) while the template, tests, and the implementation use fix_vec_dot(...) / fix_vec_dot_asm. This inconsistent identifier for the same conceptual operation (vector dot product) breaks the naming mapping across template -> tests -> implementation/solution and is likely unintentional. Students expecting the dot-product API from the template/tests (fix_vec_dot / fix_vec_dot_asm) will be confused or encounter build/link errors when the solution header uses a different name.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the dot-product identifier consistent across all artifacts. Restore the prototype in solution_repository/example_program/src/math_fix.h to use fix_vec_dot(const fix_t *v1, const fix_t *v2) (matching fix_vec_dot_asm and existing callers), or alternatively rename all uses (implementations, tests, and templates) to fix_vector_dot consistently. The minimal, least-disruptive fix is to change the prototype in solution/example_program/src/math_fix.h from fix_vector_dot(...) back to fix_vec_dot(...).
